result.execSummary:
The defendant James D. Bessette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Computer Crime-Destroy Data, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.70(2)(a)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may be discharged after 12 months, upon application of the Agent.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Walker Forge in Clintonville, unless approved by Agent.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
